• **Stochastic Resonance**: The term was introduced in the 1980s to describe the phenomenon where a signal's transmission can be improved by adding noise, making it observable. This occurs when the noise level is optimal, maximizing certain statistical quantities like the Fisher information.
• **Model and Schemes**: The paper studies a model with a threshold and a subthreshold constant signal, adding noise from an ergodic diffusion process. Two observation schemes are considered: observing the proportion of time the perturbed signal is above the threshold, or measuring the energy of the signal when it's above the threshold.
• **Asymptotic Properties and Stochastic Resonance**: The paper proposes estimators for each scheme and studies their asymptotic properties. It's shown that stochastic resonance occurs, with the Fisher information quantity having a maximum at certain noise levels, improving signal detection and parameter estimation.

• The Zero Range Potential (ZRP) approach was developed to widen the limits of traditional treatments.
• ZRP can be represented as a boundary condition on the matrix wavefunction or as a pseudopotential.
• Darboux Transformation (DT) allows for the construction of exactly solvable potentials.
• DT modifies the Generalized ZRP (GZRP) boundary condition and creates potentials with arbitrarily disposed discrete spectrum levels.
• DT can be used to dress a multi-centered potential, including multiple ZRPs.
• Electron scattering by ZRP structures was considered as an important example.
• The authors presented calculations for electron-argon scattering and discussed their results.
• The ZRP model was corrected by dressing the potential using DT.

<summary>
* In 1919, H. Weyl observed that gauge theories retain their flat-space-time form under a conformally flat metrical field.
* A model for strong interactions at low energies was proposed based on this observation, introducing two scalar fields to break symmetry and a tensor field for flat space-time.
* Quarks and gluons are confined to an anti-de Sitter universe with a finite radius, oscillating with a universal frequency independent of flavor mass.
* The model comprises one real scalar field (Φ₁₀) and one complex scalar field (Φ₁₁), with vacuum expectation values Φ₁₂ and Φ₁₃ satisfying the relation Φ₁₂/Φ₁₃ = 1/3.
* The light Φ₁₀ field is associated with confinement, while the heavy Φ₁₁ field is associated with electromagnetism.
* Weak interactions were not considered in the original model, but electroweak unification can be read for electromagnetism.
* The model does not easily allow for hadron interactions, so it was simplified to study flavor-independent oscillations, coupling the anti-de Sitter spectrum to hadronic decay channels.
</summary>

• The convection-diffusion model is a semi-linear parabolic partial differential equation used to describe various physical phenomena.
• The model is expressed mathematically and solved using various techniques, including finite element method, lattice Boltzmann method, finite difference schemes, and higher-order compact finite difference schemes.
• The stability of the model depends on the stability of the initial value system of ordinary differential equations (ODEs) obtained by discretizing the spatial derivatives.
• The stability region of the model is determined by the eigenvalues of the coefficient matrix, which must have real parts that are either zero or negative.
• The model has remarkable applications in various branches of science and engineering, such as fluid motion, heat transfer, astrophysics, oceanography, meteorology, semiconductors, hydraulics, pollutant and sediment transport, and chemical engineering.

• **Order Parameter Symmetry**: The order parameter in high-temperature superconductors (HTS) has been proven to have mainly a d-wave pairing symmetry, with a predominant d-wave gap symmetry up to the superconducting critical temperature, if any, over other minor components.
• **Thermal Transport Measurements**: Thermal transport measurements have shown the predominance of this symmetry for the gap function. In particular, when a magnetic field is rotated parallel to the CuO planes, the longitudinal thermal conductivity shows a fourfold oscillation, which can be explained by Andreev scattering of quasiparticles by vortices and Doppler shift in the energy spectrum of the quasiparticles, assuming a d-wave gap.
• **Temperature Dependence**: As the temperature increases, the fourfold oscillation is no longer observable due to thermal activation of quasiparticles at different orientations from those of the nodes of the order parameter. The amplitude of the oscillations is smaller than the simulation results at higher temperatures, which can be explained by the inclusion of an inelastic scattering into the calculations.
• **Comparison with Theory**: The experimental results can be compared with theory using the formulation proposed by Yu et al., using a two-dimensional model of the BRT expression for the thermal conductivity. The model reproduces remarkably well the symmetry of the curves in the whole measured temperature range, supporting the predominance of d-wave pairing symmetry of the order parameter up to temperatures close to the critical temperature.

* Surveys with bolometer arrays at millimetre ( mm ) and submillimetre ( submm ) wavelengths are potentially sensitive to dusty objects at extreme redshifts, galaxies that drop out of surveys at shorter and longer wavelengths due to obscuration and unfavourable @xmath11 corrections.
* The first cosmological surveys using scuba ( Holland et al. 1999 ) and mambo ( Kreysa et al. 1998 ) quickly and radically changed the accepted picture of galaxy formation and evolution, moving away from the optocentric view of the last century.
* The discovery of so-called ` scuba galaxies ' ( Smail, Ivison & Blain 1997 ) was greeted with surprise due to the remarkable evolution in the dusty, starburst galaxy population implied by such a large source density at the flux levels accessible to the first generation of bolometer arrays.

<summary>
* **Discovery and Identification**: In an extensive search for wide common proper motion companions to nearby Hipparcos stars, a faint and red star was found near Hip 115147 (BD +78 826, HD 220140, V368 Cep). This star was identified as LSPM J2322+7847, a candidate nearby low-mass dwarf, and later confirmed as LP 12-90, a star with significant proper motion reported by Luyten in 1967.
* **Photometry and Parallax**: New photometry was obtained for Hip 115147, its known visual companion Hip 115147b, and LSPM J2322+7847. Preliminary trigonometric parallax astrometry for LSPM J2322+7847 yielded a distance of 22.5 pc, suggesting it is an M-dwarf at approximately the same distance as Hip 115147.
* **Age and Origin of the System**: The system's age was estimated using model isochrones, with the best fit being a 50 Myr isochrone from Siess et al. (2000). Hip 115147 was found to have come from the vicinity of the molecular cloud LDN 1709 in the Ophiuchus star-forming region, flanking the Sco-Cen complex.
* **Activity and Variability**: Hip 115147 is a very young, naked post-T Tauri dwarf, one of the most powerful X-ray emitters in the solar neighborhood, and a variable star (V368 Cep) with a rotation period of 2.74 days. Its high degree of chromospheric and extreme ultraviolet activity suggests a very young age, possibly less than 20 Myr.
* **Companion Status**: The difference in proper motion between Hip 115147 and LSPM J2322+7847 may indicate they are not gravitationally bound, but more accurate absolute proper motions and spectroscopic radial velocities are needed to clarify their dynamical status. Despite this, the system is likely to stay close together as a moving group at the suggested age of 20-50 Myr.
* **Future Research

• **Anomaly-Mediated Supersymmetry Breaking (AMSB) Models**: AMSB models are attractive due to their calculable soft supersymmetry breaking terms, real and flavor invariant soft terms, renormalization group invariance, and sequestered hidden sector on a separate brane from the observable sector in extra-dimensional universes.
• **Challenges and Solutions**: AMSB models face the issue of negative slepton mass squared parameters leading to tachyonic states. The original solution is to add a universal mass term to the AMSB soft terms. The parameter space of the minimal AMSB model is given by m_0, m_3/2, and sign(m_0).
• **Hypercharged Anomaly-Mediated Supersymmetry Breaking (HCAMSB) Models**: HCAMSB is a string-motivated scenario that uses a similar setup as AMSB but with susy breaking localized at the bottom of a strongly warped hidden region. The warping suppresses gravity mediation and makes anomaly mediation the dominant source of susy breaking in the visible sector.
• **HCAMSB Parameter Space and Spectrum**: The parameter space of HCAMSB models is given by m_0, m_3/2, tan(β), and sign(m_0). The sparticle mass spectrum varies with the HCAMSB parameter β, with the bino mass increasing with β, and many scalar masses also varying. The superpotential term μ decreases with increasing β.
• **HCAMSB at the LHC**: The LHC reach for HCAMSB models is expected to extend up to 105 TeV (corresponding to 2.2 TeV for the gluino) for small values of β, and up to 108 TeV (corresponding to 1.1 TeV for the gluino) for large values of β. HCAMSB models should be distinguishable from AMSB models at the LHC due to the presence of long-lived chargino states in cascade decay events.

* The axial anomaly is a fundamental issue in quantum field theory, analyzed through dispersion relations and renormalization procedures, and is connected to the breaking of chiral symmetry.
* The anomaly can be interpreted as an infrared phenomenon, arising from a singularity in the chiral limit of the absorbitive part of the triangular diagram.
* The anomaly plays an essential role in various processes, including spin-dependent parton distributions and radiative decays, and can be related to polarized radiative decays.

<summary>
* Rapidity gaps, regions without hadronic activity, have been observed in hadronic collisions at HERA and the Tevatron, attributed to color singlet quantum exchange.
* At the Tevatron, a fraction of dijet events exhibit rapidity gaps between jets, demonstrating the relevance of color singlet exchange effects in QCD events at high momentum transfers.
* The two-gluon exchange model, which assumes the exchange of two gluons in a color singlet state, predicts a gap fraction of about 1%, but recent measurements by the CDF and D0 collaborations do not support this prediction.
* The authors reconsider the basic ideas behind the two-gluon exchange model, demonstrate its limitations, and show that the determination of the color singlet exchange fraction is essentially nonperturbative.
</summary>

• The aim of physics is not just to calculate observables but to understand the physical picture behind phenomena.
• In crystals, the essential degrees of freedom are electrons, ions, and the electromagnetic field, but for understanding certain properties, we work with heavy electrons, phonons, and their interactions.
• In QCD, the full nonquenched theory is too complicated at the scale of 1 GeV, but the spontaneous breaking of chiral symmetry is the most important phenomenon for understanding nucleon mass and low-energy properties.
• Light and strange baryons can be viewed as systems of three constituent quarks interacting via goldstone bosons, vector and scalar mesons, and subject to confinement.
• The chiral symmetry of the QCD Lagrangian is spontaneously broken down to SU(3) by the QCD vacuum, leading to nonzero quark condensates as an order parameter.
• The spontaneous breaking of chiral symmetry results in an octet of pseudoscalar mesons of low mass and the acquisition of a dynamical mass by valence quarks.
• The constituent quarks and goldstone bosons are coupled with a strength proportional to the quark mass, and the coupling of constituent quarks with pseudoscalar and vector mesons gives rise to various interactions.
• The spin-spin interaction between constituent quarks is of crucial importance in baryons, while the net tensor and spin-orbit interactions are weak.

• The source document discusses the construction of a decorated topological quantum field theory (TQFT) called Heegaard Floer theory in 3 dimensions, which associates a vector space to a closed, connected, oriented 3-manifold and a 2-structure on it. The document also discusses the decomposition of a 4-dimensional cobordism into one-handle, two-handle, and three-handle additions, and the corresponding maps on Heegaard Floer homology.
• The goal of the paper is to give a combinatorial procedure for calculating the ranks of the maps induced by a cobordism between two 3-manifolds, under certain conditions. The paper reviews the definitions of the vector spaces and maps involved in the TQFT, and the action of the group Z/2 on the Heegaard Floer homology groups. The paper also reviews the definitions of the maps induced by one-handle and three-handle additions.

• NGCs are a promising approach to nerve repair, but existing devices lack proper physical topography or chemical cues for nerve repair.
• The invention provides an implantable NGC with a three-dimensional spiral structured porous sheet, proximal and distal chambers, and surface channels with electrospun fibers.
• The NGC has superior mechanical strength, favorable inter-cellular interaction, and neural myelination compared to prior art NGCs.
• The NGC's proximal and distal chambers provide an optimal initial environment for nerve ingrowth and prevent stress from accruing during suturing.
• The NGC's surface channels and aligned fibers provide topographical cues for nerve regeneration and muscle reinnervation.
• The NGC's outer fibrous tube improves mechanical strength, prevents tissue infiltration, and promotes uniform nerve regeneration.
• The NGC's size is tunable, enabling it to repair long gaps in the axon for the repair or regeneration of peripheral nerves.

<summary>
• Low mass x-ray binaries (LMXBs) are compact binaries where the primary is a compact object and the secondary a low mass star.
• The secondary transfers mass via Roche-lobe overflow, forming an accretion disk around the compact object that gives rise to the observed x-rays.
• Most LMXBs are neutron star systems that can be divided into two groups: Z-sources and atoll sources.
• Z-sources are usually the brightest LMXBs in x-rays and trace a Z-like shape in their x-ray color-color diagrams.
• Atoll sources have lower accretion rates and their color-color diagrams usually consist of fragmented island-like regions.
• The main physical difference between Z-sources and atoll sources is thought to be the strength of the neutron star magnetic field and their evolutionary history.
• LMCX-2 is a persistent LMXB that shows the properties of a Z-source and is therefore thought to be a neutron star system with an accretion rate around the Eddington limit.
• It is one of the most x-ray luminous LMXBs known, but due to its extra-galactic nature, its x-ray flux is rather low.
• Its optical counterpart was identified by Pakull in 1978 as a blue star.
• Despite being x-ray luminous and having a known optical counterpart, little is known about the system parameters of LMCX-2.
• Estimates for the orbital period range from 6.4 hours to 12 days, and no periodic variability was detected in 6 years of MACHO data.
• In recent years, Steeghs and Casares developed a new technique to detect a signature of the donor star in persistent LMXBs.
• Using phase-resolved spectroscopy, they detected narrow emission lines in SCO X-1, especially in the Bowen blend.
• This discovery was followed by a survey of other LMXBs that are optically bright enough to also resolve these narrow components.
• In this paper, the authors apply the technique of Bowen fluorescence to LMCX-2.
• They show that it is possible to detect a periodic signal in their spectroscopic dataset that they identify as the orbital period.
• Similar to other X-ray binaries thus far, the Bowen region shows the presence of narrow emission lines that the authors identify as coming from the irradiated side of the companion.
• This gives the first ever constraints on the system parameters of LMCX-2.

* The leg assemblies can be pivoted together by their respective actuators to raise or lower the deck support frame while keeping it substantially parallel to the floor, or one of the foot or head end assemblies can be pivoted to move the deck support frame into the Trendelenburg or reverse Trendelenburg positions.
* Known arrangements for pivoting leg assemblies relative to a deck support frame include a leg element pivotally connected at its upper end to a guide element which is coupled to and can slide along the outside of longitudinal elements arranged parallel to, or forming, the sides of the deck support frame.
* These known arrangements suffer from problems such as a risk of trapping fingers in the guide element, a need to overcome frictional forces between the inner surface of the slideable guide element and the outer surface of the longitudinal element, and a propensity for dust and dirt to collect on the surface of the longitudinal element and interfere with the sliding operation.
* US 2009/0094747 and US 2010/0050343 disclose alternative arrangements in which channels are arranged on the sides of the intermediate or deck support frame and have follower or guide elements extending into the interior of the channels through the vertical open side.
* US 2006/0021143 discloses a further alternative arrangement in which guide tracks or channels are defined by slots extending through the vertical sides of longitudinal bed frame elements, and the upper end of the respective leg assemblies are provided with followers extending sideways out from the upper end of the leg assemblies to extend through or into the slots.
* A need exists for further contributions in this area of technology.

• The present application is a continuation-in-part of two previous applications, Ser. No. 172,806 and Ser. No. 031,752.
• All equitable rights are claimed for the second previous application, which was abandoned.
• The invention relates to a process for mounting glass panels in curved window bays of motor vehicles.
• The method aims to use flat, uncurved glass panels to form curved windows in vehicles.
• Currently, even slightly curved windows are pre-contoured and tempered, which makes them less flexible and more brittle.
• Pre-contoured glass can dislodge and shatter in vehicular accidents, and it's more expensive than flat glass.
• The invention seeks to overcome these disadvantages by flexing flat glass in situ to conform to curved window openings.
• A continuous bead of adhesive sealant is applied between the glass panel and the window opening to permanently hold the glass in place.
• The adhesive sealant is applied while the glass panel is flexed, creating an urgency to return to its flat shape, which helps to secure the glass.
• The method uses a reveal molding and clips to temporarily hold the glass panel in place until the adhesive cures and sets the glass permanently in its curved shape.

• The invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that can adapt to different protocols of an output from a vehicle control, such as a reverse-gear indication.
• The system uses a microcomputer with software to determine the protocol by monitoring the output and adjusting parameters based on the vehicle's state over time.

• The document describes a related application for a disposable finishing article drive member assembly.
• The invention relates to finishing articles with a mounting hub for quick attachment and release to a portable power tool.
• The background discusses problems with securing finishing articles to drive shafts and the use of adhesives and keyways in prior art solutions.
• The invention aims to address disadvantages of prior art devices, such as the use of adhesives, keyed parts, and bulky die-cast mounting hubs.
• The finishing article has a drive member non-removably affixed thereto, including a backing flange with gripping means and a retaining nut.
• The retaining nut extends through the finishing article and has a radial flange at one end and protrusion means at the other end for securing the nut and backing flange together without adhesives.
• A pressure cap is held in place by the gripping means on the backing flange and extends to engage the power tool spindle seat, placing the finishing article in compression during use.
• The finishing article is placed in compression as it is secured onto the spindle, with additional compression occurring as the article is used.
• The invention provides a secure attachment, precludes relative rotation of the finishing article, and offers a smooth, vibration-free operation.

* The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel, cooperating with the anti-lock braking device to achieve anti-dive characteristics.

• The apparatus for the second embodiment consists of a blower, mask, air delivery hose, exhaust, pneumotachograph, differential pressure transducer, microprocessor, pressure transducer, motor servo, and user configurable parameters loaded via a communications port.
• The microprocessor performs calculations and procedures, including measuring flow and pressure, calculating mask flow and pressure, determining mask on/off status and lead-in, calculating instantaneous and recent peak jamming, adjusting time constant for leak conductance calculations, determining phase in respiratory cycle, updating mean rates of change of phase, adding hose pressure loss to EPAP pressure, calculating instantaneous elastic assistance, estimating instantaneous elastic recoil pressure, weighting and combining estimates, adding servo pressure to yield desired sensor pressure, and servo-controlling motor speed to achieve desired sensor pressure.
• The microprocessor calculates respiratory airflow by subtracting instantaneous leak from mask flow, and low pass filters the respiratory airflow to remove cardiogenic airflow and other noise.
• The microprocessor determines mask on/off status by detecting an off-on transition when respiratory airflow first goes above 0.2 L/sec, and an on-off transition when mask pressure is less than 2 cmH2O for more than 1.5 seconds.
• The microprocessor calculates lead-in, which runs from zero if the mask is off or recently donned, to 1.0 if the mask has been on for 20 seconds or more.
• The microprocessor calculates the instantaneous jamming index J by determining the fuzzy extent to which the impedance of the leak has suddenly changed, and calculates the recent peak jamming index J PEAK by setting it to equal the instantaneous jamming index if it is larger, or low pass filtering the instantaneous jamming index with a time constant of 10 seconds otherwise.
• The microprocessor adjusts the time constant for leak conductance calculations based on J PEAK, which is a measure of the fuzzy extent that the leak has recently suddenly changed.

• The microprocessor estimates the mean duration of inspiration T I , expiration T E , cycle time T TOT , and respiratory rate RR by updating the estimated duration of inspiration or expiration based on the current phase, and calculating the observed mean duration of a breath and respiratory rate.
• The microprocessor calculates the desired instantaneous delivery pressure by adding the desired pressure modulation amplitude to the end expir

• The invention is a gate valve for controlling bulk dispensing of viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches.
• It is designed to be operated with one hand while the other hand holds the receiving vessel.
• The valve consists of a tubular sleeve that inserts into the bag's spout and a dispensing passage extending through it.
• At the outlet end of the passage, a guide extends at a right angle to the axis, carrying a reciprocable gate.
• Cooperating lugs on the gate and guide allow for one-handed operation.
• The gate and guide are curved complementally transversely to draw the gate into sealing engagement with the outlet.
• When the gate is completely opened, there is no obstruction to flow, and when it moves towards the closed position, variable flow occurs.
• The valve can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily.
• It functions effectively when the bag is mounted in an inclined position in a dispenser.

• **Prior Art**: Early rail car truck bowl liners were made of hard metal alloys like manganese steel, requiring periodic lubrication. Recent liners use ultra high molecular weight polymer (UHMW-PE) for self-lubrication, but they are nonconductive, necessitating separate grounding apparatus.
• **Invention's Aim**: The invention aims to provide a conductive UHMW-PE liner for railroad car center plate assemblies, eliminating the need for additional grounding apparatus while maintaining the self-lubricating properties of UHMW-PE.
• **Liner Composition**: The liner is composed of UHMW-PE with a conductive material additive, preferably 2.0% carbon black, to achieve the desired electrical conductivity.
• **Liner Configurations**: The liner can be bowl-shaped or flat horizontal disk, with or without a conductive ring, to fit various car designs and meet different electrical conductivity standards.
• **Mechanical Properties**: The UHMW-PE material resists distension, compaction, and has high elastic memory, providing excellent wear resistance and load-bearing capabilities.
• **Electrical Properties**: The liner meets or exceeds the electrical conductivity standards of 1×10 5  ohms (100 Kohms), ensuring effective grounding and static dissipation.

<summary>
* The invention relates to pallet systems that facilitate loading and unloading, and limit the shifting of loaded items.
* The pallet system includes a pallet with raised, parallel guide rails to straddle tray side supports, restricting lateral movement.
* End stops and vertically positioned end plates further restrict longitudinal movement and provide stability when loaded and wrapped.
* The pallet allows trays to be slid on and off, making it suitable for automated loading and unloading.
</summary>

* The invention pertains to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension for aviation aircrafts.
* The saucer has a compact, efficient rotary-wing system and power system, designed to fit within the limited internal space of the saucer shell.
* The magnetic suspension structure avoids contact and friction between the high-speed rotary-wing and the saucer shell, reducing noise and vibration.
* The saucer can overcome reactive torque of the rotary wings through coaxial axial or radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems.

<summary>

If the limit value is exceeded, the jacket unit is displaceable parallel to the longitudinal axis in the direction toward the motor vehicle front. The jacket unit is connected with the retaining part, for one, across an energy absorption connection, which comprises at least one bending wire or strip that, upon a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part parallel to the longitudinal direction toward the motor vehicle front, is deformed, and is connected, for another, across a break-away connection which, up to the limit value of the force, is closed and blocks a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part and which is released if the limit value of the force is exceeded.
* The steering column is preferably implemented such that it is adjustable in length. An openable and closable securement device is herein provided, in the opened state of which the jacket unit is displaceable with respect to a bracket unit supporting the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft and which, in its closed state, applies a securement force for the securement of the jacket unit with respect to the bracket unit against a displacement parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft. In the mounted state of the steering column the bracket unit is herein firmly secured on the vehicle, at least in normal operation, thus without a crash having occurred, e.g. up to a maximum force acting in the direction of the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.
* The retaining part is formed by a part of the securement device. The retaining part in the closed state of the securement device is herein in engagement with a securement part which is secured in position with respect to the bracket unit such that it is nondisplaceable in the direction of the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft. Through this engagement between the securement part and the retaining part, at least a portion of the securement force is applied securing, in the closed state of the securement device, the jacket unit against a displacement parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft. In the opened state of the securement device, the retaining part and the securement part are out of engagement. However, the energy absorption device for enabling

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
* The assembly reduces pressure variances in the output pressure and allows for the use of a less expensive regulator.
* It comprises a pressurized fluid source, first and second transport means, a fluid regulator, and means for converting pressurized fluid into mechanical power.
* The converting means is preferably a vane pump that converts pressurized fluid into movement of vanes, which can then be converted into rotational or electrical energy.
* In one embodiment, the assembly is used in a gas grill, where the vane motor drives an electrical generator that powers a rotisserie.
* In another embodiment, two vane motors are used, one to generate electricity and one to produce mechanical work, such as driving a vehicle.
* In yet another embodiment, the assembly is used in a self-contained underwater breathing apparatus (scuba), where the vane motor drives an electrical generator that powers a headlight.
</summary>

• The invention concerns streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, a process for their production, and their use in isolation, purification, and detection of proteins.
• The streptavidin muteins are characterized by at least one mutation in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, which results in a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands compared to wild-type streptavidin.
• The invention also includes nucleic acids encoding the streptavidin muteins, vectors containing these nucleic acids, cells transformed with these vectors, and a process for producing the streptavidin muteins using these cells.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies, specifically addressing the problem of restricted disengagement of vapor retained in the liquid.
* The invention includes an improved tray valve assembly for a process column, comprising a plurality of apertures formed in the tray with a valve cover mounted thereon, having first and second legs, the first leg being wider than the second leg and disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray.
* The valve cover is mounted in outwardly slotted portions of the tray for defining the orientation of the valve relative to the liquid flow, and includes means for selectively biasing the rear region of the valve upwardly against the flow of liquid for facilitating initial, directionalized vapor flow therethrough.
* The invention also includes a method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer of a process column onto an underlying cross-flow tray, comprising forming the tray with a plurality of directional thrust valves disposed therein, the valves being formed of generally circular disc members disposed above circular apertures formed within the tray, with first and second legs in support thereof, the first leg being wider than the second leg for directing flow therearound.
</summary>

* The invention describes a process of producing transgenic plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest and capable of expressing a function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
* The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors, which are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination in said plant cells for producing a non-replicating recombination product containing said DNA sequence of interest.
* The at least two different vectors are also adapted for integrating said DNA sequence of interest into said chromosome, and said DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two of said at least two different vectors, said sequence portions being necessary for expressing said function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
* The process also involves selecting plants or plant cells expressing said function of interest.

• The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, with a thickness of 10 to 350 μm.
• The film comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber, and has good orientability and thermoformability, as well as very good optical and mechanical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
* The apparatus includes means for supplying and passing the aluminum strip or wire through various baths.
* The first bath is a degreasing bath to remove oils and fats from the aluminum surface.
* The second bath is an etching bath to provide a matt surface on the aluminum.
* The third bath is a current supply bath where the aluminum acts as a cathode for electrolytic degreasing.
* The fourth bath is an anodic oxidation bath where an oxide film is formed on the aluminum.
* The fifth bath is an electrolytic coloring bath where the anodized aluminum is colored.
* The sixth bath is a sealing bath to seal the colored oxide film.
* The apparatus uses a power source connected to electrodes in the oxidation and coloring baths.
* The aluminum strip or wire functions as an anode in the oxidation bath and a cathode in the coloring bath without direct connection to the power source.
* The apparatus can produce aluminum strips or wires with colored oxide films having excellent weatherability or fade resistance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to movable partitions and panels for separating or insulating cargo during transportation or storage, particularly for multi-temperature transport.
* Current partitions and bulkheads in refrigerated trailers, railcars, and containers are modular, extending from floor to ceiling, and are used to divide cargo spaces into sections of varying sizes.
* Insulated bulkheads extend across the width of a trailer to form separate fore and aft cargo areas, allowing for different temperature control in each area.
* The present invention improves upon existing partition systems by allowing at least two panels to be independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies, enabling each panel to move independently.
* In a preferred embodiment, two bulkheads or panels are slidably attached to separate pairs of ceiling-mounted rails in a refrigerated trailer, allowing each bulkhead or panel to be independently slid towards the front or rear of the trailer to define different cargo areas.
* Another preferred embodiment involves two panels in the form of half-width bulkheads that are releasably secured to one another and independently, slidably attached to the ceiling of the trailer, allowing each half-width bulkhead to be independently raised and lowered with minimal fore and aft clearance.
* The panels are slidably attached to the rails with a trolley assembly, which permits the panels to be moved in the fore and aft direction and raised like garage doors to be secured to the ceiling when not in use.
* The mounting assembly is preferably a trolley assembly, but may optionally be replaced with any mechanism that permits rotational, slideable, or hinged movement between the rails and the bulkhead.
* The receiving means can be a series of individual receptacles disposed along the ceiling of the trailer, and the mounting means can be a series of individual mounting members that cooperate with the selected receiving means.
* The panels can be secured relative to one another with a variety of known means, such as cooperating straps and buckles, channels, grooves, flanges, polymeric seals, or locking pins.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, specifically for preventing reflection of light from lower layers during photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources such as 248 nm (KrF) and 193 nm (ArF).
* The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at wavelengths of 193 nm and 248 nm, and are prepared by reacting polyhydroxystyrene resin, poly(styrene-acrylate) resin, or novolac resin with diazonaphthoquinone halide in the presence of an amine. The invention also provides anti-reflective coating compositions containing these polymers alone or in combination with light-absorbing compounds, and methods for their preparation and use.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an improved process for deacylation and desulfurization of a compound, using hypophosphorous acid to increase product yield and reduce impurities.
• The process is used to synthesize pyrazolotriazoles, useful as magenta couplers in photography, from their triazolothiadiazine precursors.
• The improvement involves using hypophosphorous acid in the deacylation and desulfurization step to reduce elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
• Without hypophosphorous acid, the process yields low amounts of the desired product and high levels of impurities, such as thione and disulfide.
• With hypophosphorous acid, the process yields the desired product in high purity and with improved yield.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid also results in the formation of H2S, which can be easily removed from the reaction zone.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibers, involving twice health-preserving bast fibers and spinning them into yarn.
* The process includes health-preserving bast fibers, opening and cleaning them, carding, drawing into strips, health-preserving the strips, and spinning into yarn.
* The invention also includes a process for blended spinning bast fibers and other fibers, with similar steps and conditions.
</summary>

• The invention relates to weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom, specifically to inserting different weft threads with appropriate weft carrying forces.
• Prior looms use uniform air pressure for all weft threads, leading to varying insertion speeds and wasted air pressure for thinner threads.
• The invention proposes ejecting air from main nozzles and/or subnozzles at different pressures or for different intervals to suit each weft thread's requirements.
• This ensures stable weft insertion at the same speed for all threads, preventing undue air pressure consumption.

• **Invention Background**: The invention relates to a novel sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography and fluid handling, specifically designed for pharmaceutical industry applications. It aims to address the limitations of existing rotary valves by providing a means for sanitizing the valve in place without disassembly.
• **Prior Art**: Existing rotary valves, such as those described in U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,808,317, 2,985,589, 3,268,604, 4,409,033, and others, do not provide sanitizable features. Known non-rotary sanitizable valves, like those granted to Mieth, Dolling, Ringo, and Pruett, do not have rotary designs. U.S. Pat. No. 4,921,015 and 4,625,763 describe rotary valves with sealing means but lack sanitizable aspects.
• **Invention Summary**: The invention is a novel type of rotary valve that combines elements from the valve art with a unique feature allowing partial separation of the rotor-stator faces for flushing and cleaning. It comprises a rotor with a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm molded to form multiple sealing ports and a stator with corresponding ports and gutters. The diaphragm has integral dynamic wipe sealing lips that maintain fluid-tight sealing engagement with the stator face even when the rotor is moved orthogonally away from the stator for sanitization.
• **Invention Operation**: The valve operates by rotating the rotor to index the ports, allowing fluid flow between the rotor and stator ports. For sanitization, the rotor is moved orthogonally away from the stator, breaking the seal between the rotor sealing ports and the stator face. Sanitizing fluid is then flushed across the sealing faces of the stator and the diaphragm, cleaning the port sealing faces. The valve also has a barrier fluid flow path to prevent accumulation of dried material and release of solution to the external environment.
• **Invention Applications**: The invention is designed for use in liquid chromatographic columns and sanitary liquid handling systems to separate and/or purify biological macromolecules of importance to the pharmaceutical industry. It can be adapted for use in simulated moving bed (SMB) adsorption and separation processes, such as those used in the Sorbex Cascade system for hydrocarbon fractionation and fructose enrichment, and in ion exchange fractionation separation systems with separate flowpaths for adsorption, desorption, and stripping.

• **Background**: The invention concerns methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, specifically nickel in the zero oxidation state derived from alloys like nickel-boride, nickel-phosphide, aluminum-nickel, or supported on kieselguhr or silica/alumina. These methods aim to synthesize guanidines under mild conditions, with high yields, and minimal reagents, while avoiding toxic catalysts.
• **Prior Art**: Traditional guanylation methods use coupling reagents and bases, often requiring excess amounts and longer reaction times. Mercuric salts, though effective, are toxic and difficult to separate from the product. N-alkyl substituted S-methylisothioureas are inadequate for guanylating aliphatic primary and secondary amines due to reversibility and the need to remove methyl mercaptan.
• **Invention**: The invention provides methods of forming substituted guanidines by reacting guanylating agents (thioureas or isothioureas) with amines or pyrrolidines in the presence of a nickel catalyst. Preferred guanylating agents include bis-protected thioureas and isothioureas, with Boc and Cbz as preferred protecting groups.
• **Reaction Conditions**: The reactions are preferably carried out at temperatures ranging from -30 to 140°C, more preferably at room temperature or under ambient conditions, in a solvent system comprising DMF, THF, DMSO, or water mixed with any of the foregoing. The nickel catalyst should be present at less than about 10 molar % nickel, preferably less than about 5 molar % nickel, based on the total moles of guanylating agent(s).
• **Examples**: The invention demonstrates the synthesis of various N-substituted and N,N-disubstituted guanidines from bis-protected thioureas and isothioureas in the presence of nickel catalysts. The methods show high yields and efficiency, with the nickel catalyst acting catalytically in some cases.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor, specifically an improvement to reduce frictional wear on components by applying a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate facial surfaces and ends.
* Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning systems, with the swash plate rotating about a shaft and reciprocating pistons via pivoting shoes.
* The interfacial surfaces between the swash plate and pistons are subject to high loads and susceptible to premature wear, affecting compressor life and efficiency.
* Previous coatings, such as a metal matrix coating with tin and silicon, required expensive, high silicon aluminum base materials, high surface finishing, and a complex electroplating process.
* Adding a fluororesin to the metal matrix improved the coefficient of friction but reduced surface hardness and durability.
* The present invention aims to provide a coating that is both friction reducing and highly durable, allowing for the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum base material and eliminating the need for electroplating.
* The coating comprises a heat curable, cross-linked polyfluoro elastomer bonded directly to the aluminum, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive.
* The coating is applied by liquid spray, with the swash plate facial surfaces and end surface being simultaneously coated, and the piston shoe may also be coated to further increase low friction properties.
* The coating is applied in an aqueous spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature, with preferred curing times and temperatures being about 10 minutes at 450° F.
* Experimental results show that the Fluorolon™325 coated swash plate made with hypereutectic aluminum sustained seizure loads over ten times greater than uncoated hypereutectic aluminum swash plates and approximately five times those of hypereutectic aluminum swash plates coated with tin or tin/zinc.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types, sequentially taking partial quantities from individual fiber bales.
* The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber bale before each pass of the bale opener and determining a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity.
* The determined partial quantity is continuously removed only from the measured fiber bale during each pass, ensuring that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
* In a preferred embodiment, the partial quantity from each stored fiber lot is removed not later than by the end of a predetermined period to maintain a determined time schedule and prevent idle running of after-connected processing machines.
* The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener based on signals transmitted by the quantity measuring device.
* The control device has a control apparatus and a computer, with a timing relay that predetermines a maximum period for removing the partial quantity from each stored fiber lot.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an improved method for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 142b (1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane) using heterogeneous catalysis.
• The organic feed is 142b and the fluorinating agent is HF (hydrofluoric acid).
• The process is carried out in a reactor at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 30° C. and 280° C., more preferably between 100° C. and 250° C., and most preferably between 120° C. and 200° C.
• The catalyst has to be activated first using nitrogen, air or HF/142b at a temperature between 100° C. and 650° C., preferably between 200° C. and 500° C.
• The molar ratio of HF to 142b in the feed is greater than 1:1, preferably greater than 2.5:1.
• The process can be carried out at a pressure between 1 atmosphere (0 psig) and 200 psig, preferably between 1 atmosphere and 150 psig.
• The catalyst can be any (supported or unsupported) chromium salt, and the two catalysts that have been used to provide high conversion rates in this process are CrF3.4H2O (powder or pelletized), and Cr/Ni/AlF3.

• **Fabric Formation**: The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns in at least two layers laid at an angle of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric, held together by stitching or other external means.
• **Prior Art**: The prior art includes methods for forming bias laid fabrics, but none provide fully parallel courses with partial overlap of return courses, or allow yarns to be either placed between holding means or impaled on them.
• **Rake Mechanism**: The invention introduces a rake mechanism synchronized with but driven separately from the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, to ensure parallelism of yarns and allow successive courses to overlie a portion of an already laid course, parallel to the first courses.
• **Rake Needles**: The needles on the rake system are formed at an angle to correspond and supplement the angle of the approaching yarns being fed by the yarn carrying means, at each end of the travel limits of the yarn carrying means.
• **Rake Operation**: The rake mechanism accepts and retains the yarns being carried by the yarn carrying means at either end of the extremities of travel of the yarn carrying means, and places the yarns onto or between the appropriate needles on the conveyors of the fabric forming mechanism.
• **Fabric Control**: The invention allows control of fabric density and uniformity by varying the amount of overlap of return courses onto the first courses, without loss of parallelism, and without requiring too high a concentration of yarns in each carrier.

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board, supporting an electric iron's cord and holding items like spray starch cans or beverage containers.
* The apparatus features a 'C' shaped clamp for securing it to the ironing board, a flexible cord support with a raised and retracted position, and a detachable article holder with tangs that fit into openings on the clamp.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of making nonwoven fabrics with a three-dimensional image, suitable for various consumer applications.
* The production of conventional textile fabrics is complex and multi-step, involving processes like carding, drawing, roving, spinning, and weaving.
* Nonwoven fabrics, produced directly from the carding process, are more efficient but have disadvantages in terms of resistance to elongation.
* Hydroentangled fabrics with improved properties and subsequent binder application or thermal stabilization enhance fabric durability.
* The use of scrim material, such as spunbond, provides reinforcement to nonwoven composite fabrics.
* The invention aims to create a two-sided, three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric with a pronounced image and requisite mechanical characteristics.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for sewing machines, aiming to produce buttonholes that close without overlap regardless of the type of material being sewn.
* The device includes a foot pad attachable to a presser bar and a travelling assembly with an initial position defined by oppositely acting springs.
* The travelling assembly moves with the work during buttonhole sewing and includes a slidable member positionable by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn.
* The slidable member carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine, limiting the buttonhole length to that suitable for the inserted button.
* An adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate buttonhole formation, allowing precise definition of the closure point.
* The device is designed to work with machines that sew buttonholes in two halves, with top bar and left leg stitches first, followed by bottom bar and right leg stitches.
* The adjustable stop allows operators to compensate for different materials' slippage, ensuring perfect buttonholes in various fabrics.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a sensing roll for use in nip presses, which exerts pressing forces on webs for forming paper, textile material, plastic foil, and other related materials. The sensing roll is designed to measure and compensate for rotational variability, allowing for a more accurate display of the nip pressure profile.
• The sensing roll comprises strategically-placed sensors, including a first set of sensors disposed in a particular configuration along a roll cover that overlies a cylindrical member. Each sensor of this first set is located at a particular lateral position (cross-directional position) on the roll cover. The sensing roll further includes additional sets of sensors which are likewise disposed in a particular configuration on the roll cover, each sensor of the plural sets of sensors being disposed at a particular cross-directional position. Each sensor is configured to sense and measure pressure when the sensor enters the nip region of the nip press. The plurality of readings can be used to calculate and formulate the nip pressure profile and rotational variability profile for the press.

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments and forming nonwoven webs.
• It aims to improve upon existing eductive, non-eductive, and hybrid systems.
• The system uses an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width.
• The linear plane of filaments has constant filament distribution across the machine width, providing good control of cross-machine uniformity.
• No air is educted into the system; the quench fluid (usually air) undergoes uniform acceleration into the impingement slot where the drawing force is developed.
• The same air is used for quenching and drawing, simplifying the process and reducing energy consumption.
• The drawing chamber is small, allowing for higher quench pressures without structural deflection problems.
• The system is easy to clean, with only the tips of the air knives exposed to the fiber stream.
• The method and apparatus are flexible and can accommodate a wide variety of materials and operating conditions.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
* The device ensures continuous operation, allows sewing of relatively stiff strips, and is insensitive to disturbances.
* A stop is used to position the strip, which is then sewn onto the fabric in a single feed motion.
* The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever biased by a spring and controlled by a signal transmitter.
* The stop is displaced substantially perpendicularly to the feed motion of the workpiece by an air cylinder.
* The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
* The device controls the switching functions of the sewing machine based on the position of the stop and the strip material.
</summary>

• **Frame Quilting Machine Design**: The automatic quilting machine consists of a pair of posts supporting two cross beams, with a sewing machine head attached to the upper beam and a sewing plate on the lower beam. A quilt table, supported by two movable tracks, can move in the X and Y directions, allowing the entire table surface to be accessed by the sewing needle.
• **Electronic Control System**: The machine's electronic control system includes two separate process controllers: one for controlling the quilting table's X-Y movement and another for controlling the sewing machine's functions. The X-Y movement controller is connected to X and Y motors via X and Y axis controllers, while the sewing machine controller receives voltage commands from the X-Y movement controller and converts them into RPM commands for the sewing machine.
• **Computer-Aided Design and Pattern Duplication**: The quilting table's process controller is connected to a monitor and can be programmed using a computer-aided design (CAD) program. The operator can draw a pattern on the monitor using a cursor moving apparatus, convert it into machine-readable form using the CAD program, and program the table to move in the desired pattern direction. The process controller can also be programmed to duplicate the pattern at specific points on the fabric.

• **Invention Overview**: The invention relates to preparations for enhancing utility of cellulosic fabric materials, using wool particles or wool powder as functional additive carriers, and bamboo fibre for moisture management.
• **Preparation Components**: The preparations comprise a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder (preferably macrofibril size or below), a binding agent, and functional additives like anti-UV agents (zinc oxide, titanium oxide), anti-bacterial agents (nano-silver, zinc oxide, titanium oxide), or bamboo powder for improved moisture management.
• **Preparation Method**: The method involves pulverizing wool or bamboo fibre into ultrafine powder, forming a suspension, adding functional additives, and mixing with a binding agent. The preparation is then applied to the fabric by printing, padding, or foam application.
• **Fabric Enhancements**: Treated fabrics show enhanced ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial properties, moisture management, wicking, and wrinkle resistance. These properties remain durable even after multiple washing cycles.
• **Fabric Types**: The invention is applicable to various cellulosic fabric materials, including cotton, linen, and bamboo-blended fabrics, and can be applied to different fabric types like knitted or woven fabrics.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a flexible traction element, production line, and method for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material.
* The traction element comprises stranded cables with a core strand sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material layer.
* The production line includes a reel for unwinding stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater, an extruder for co-extrusion, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.
* The method involves degreasing and preheating stranded cables, and sheathing them with liquefied plastics material in an extruder.
* The extruder has a thread guide for stranded cables and at least one matrix, which can be adjusted with and in relation to one another in a plane angled with respect to the cable plane.

• The sewing machine 1 can identify the specified position on the work cloth 100 using the ultrasonic pen 92.
• The sewing machine 1 detects the ultrasonic wave using the receivers 94, 95, and 96.
• The CPU 61 calculates the specified coordinates E based on the detection timings T 2 of the receivers 94, 95, and 96.
• The CPU 61 does not acquire the transmission timing T 1 of the ultrasonic wave.
• The CPU 61 uses Formulas (13), (14), and (15) to calculate the specified coordinates E.
• The CPU 61 determines whether at least one of the receivers 94, 95, and 96 has detected the ultrasonic wave.
• If none of the receivers 94, 95, and 96 has detected the ultrasonic wave, the CPU 61 determines whether the ultrasonic wave has been detected after the main processing has been started.
• If the ultrasonic wave has not been detected after the main processing has been started, the CPU 61 displays an error message on the LCD 15.
• The CPU 61 controls the sewing machine 1 to sew on the work cloth 100 based on the calculated specified coordinates E.

* The invention provides methods for producing silicon-based nanowires and films using liquid silane inks by electrospinning.
* Four-component inks consist of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent, while five-component inks add a solid phase component.
* The methods involve expelling the ink through a nozzle in a high electric field to form continuous fibers, transforming the fibers by thermal or laser processing, and optionally coating the transformed fibers with a conductive material.

* The invention describes a simplified process for producing viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process involves partial coagulation, completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, and drying.
* The washing step reduces specific impurities to achieve a degree of white not lower than 45.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, aiming to minimize hindrance to the guiding of the needle thread loop and its pull-back after maximum expansion.
* All housing-side holding means are located on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand unhindered until its maximum expansion is reached.
* The needle thread loop is then pulled back by the thread take-up lever, moving through the gap between the front cam and the shoulder without touching the front cam, and causing only a slight bending of the low-mass spring rod.
* The rear cam serves only as a supporting element for the spring rod and does not come into contact with the bobbin housing or the needle thread loop, allowing the needle thread loop to be pulled back through the stitch hole by the thread feeder totally unhindered.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method for connecting rope- or tape-shaped knit fabrics in various garments.
* The method aims to improve productivity, appearance, and comfort by eliminating the need for separate sewing processes.
* Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted on a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds.
* The knit pieces are positioned with a boundary between them on one of the needle beds.
* Symmetrical loops of the final course of both knit pieces are overlaid and bound off gradually.
* This process is repeated until the two pieces are connected.
* The method uses a flat knitting machine with needle beds disposed at least in a pair of front and rear sides, with one or both being movable in the lateral direction.
* Two pieces of tape-shaped knit fabric are knitted in a specified length by arbitrary needles in different ranges across the boundary.
* When both knit fabrics reach a specified length, the loop portion of the final course of one knit fabric is transferred to the needles of the other needle bed.
* The needle bed is moved so that the loop portion of the end part of the moving side knit fabric is overlaid on the loop of the end part of the fixed side knit fabric.
</summary>

• The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
• The BTR composites are designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process and topology optimization, and consist of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels.

<summary>
* The invention is an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each having a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element.
* The braking element is coupled to a tensioning lever with a roller biased by departing threads, taking an angular position dependent on thread tension and net weight.
* The arrangement includes a biasing arrangement activated by fluid pressure, connected to the tensioning lever, and simultaneously settable for all spool holders.
* The biasing arrangement preferably uses a piston/cylinder assembly and operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever to alter thread tension.
* The tensioning lever subtends an angle A to the horizontal plane of more than 45°, and the biasing arrangement subtends an angle B of less than 45°.
* The biasing arrangement may also operate on a brake shoe applied to a further rotating braking surface for rapid braking at shut-down.
</summary>

• **Cross-Reference to Related Applications:**

• **Background of the Invention:**
  - The invention relates to an air flow system for a dry cleaner that induces ambient air into the machine whenever the door is opened.
  - Previous systems exhausted tubs of residual solvent vapors, which was acceptable for less expensive solvents but not for more volatile and expensive ones.
  - The present invention provides an air flow system that is exclusive of the air recirculating system and reduces exhausting of residual solvent vapors from the tubs.

• **Summary of the Invention:**
  - The dry cleaning machine provides an air flow system for bringing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened.
  - A separate intake fan and duct are provided, with the duct interposed between the access opening and the open ends of the interior tubs.
  - The duct includes a normally closed valve that isolates the separate intake system from solvent vapors during normal operation.

• **Description of the Drawings:**
  - FIG. 1 is a perspective schematic drawing of the dry cleaner primarily showing the solvent distributing system and the air distributing system of the present invention.
  - FIG. 2 is a perspective schematic drawing similar to FIG. 1 for primarily showing the air distributing system and a refrigeration system for solvent vapor recovery.
  - FIG. 3 is a timer cycle chart indicating the timer-energized components during each portion of the dry cleaning cycle.
  - FIG. 4 is a simplified schematic wiring diagram showing the machine controls.

• **Description of the Preferred Embodiment:**
  - The dry cleaner has nested tubs with a common horizontal access and an outer cabinet with an access opening and a front opening door.
  - The forward concentric openings of the tubs are spaced from the wall of the cabinet to accommodate a header chamber with opposed walls defining concentric openings.
  - The header chamber has attached thereto a pair of airflow hoses, with another air hose attached to the stationary outer tub at some point axially remote

<summary>
* The application is a continuation of an earlier abandoned application.
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating dyed or printed textile webs with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution.
* The apparatus aims to improve upon existing techniques by providing a more effective and gentle treatment for various types of fabrics, including knitted materials and printed matter.
* The apparatus comprises a conveyor with an endless sieve belt, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The conveyor transports the textile web along a substantially horizontal path, while the applicator applies the liquid at a first station and the suction device removes it at a second station downstream of the first.
* The dwell stretch conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop, lengthening the action time of the applied liquid.
* In one embodiment, the dwell stretch is an air pass with freely rotatable rollers guiding the web in vertically extending loops.
* In another embodiment, the dwell stretch includes a freely rotatable drum and rollers guiding the web along a meander path.
* The suction device is advantageously disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt, causing the web to adhere to the belt and be entrained thereby.
* The apparatus can have a compact construction, with the textile web guided back to the sieve belt closely adjacent to the point where it leaves the belt.
* The invention is particularly suitable for so-called "soilage washing" and can be followed by a fastness treatment.
* The apparatus can treat a wide range of fabrics, including knitted materials, without causing tension or smudging printed matter.
* The use of an air pass or drum allows the textile web to be accessible to the atmosphere at all sides, promoting effective washing.
* The apparatus can comprise multiple assembly units, each with an applicator, dwell stretch, and suction device, spaced along the path defined by the upper sieve belt section.
* The sieve belt and drum designs enable the textile web to be guided with particularly little tension, preventing appreciable longitudinal tensile stresses.
* The apparatus can collect and recycle liquid using catch plates disposed below the upper and lower sections of the sieve belt.
* The textile web is guided in a single layer in a spread-out state and lies tensionless on the upper section of the sieve belt.
* The liquid applicator applies the washing or rinsing liquid substantially uniformly over the width of the textile web.
* The suction device removes the liquid and the greater part of the substances

* The invention uses pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to stimulate crude oil reservoirs and enhance production.

• **Improved Sewing Machine Detector Design:**
  - Utilizes flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs for detecting needle position and sewing machine speed, replacing conventional rotary reflective discs.
  - Discs are coaxially mounted on a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft, allowing for easy angle adjustment and differentiation.
  - Discs are made of light-transmitting synthetic resin with printed light shielding areas and indicator arrows for precise angle determination.

• **Optical Fiber Support and Reflecting Portions:**
  - Optical fibers are supported linearly in an optical fiber supporter, reducing stress and enabling additional optical axes.
  - Reflecting portions are provided in two places, opposite the ends of the light sending and receiving optical fibers.
  - Reflecting portions are provided by plating or attaching reflective plates, ensuring accurate reflection and signal detection.

• **Power Indication and Signal Detection:**
  - Power indication is achieved through an optical fiber cable running from the module section to the detecting section, eliminating electrical interference.
  - The detector can simultaneously detect multiple signals, such as needle UP/DOWN positions, sewing machine speed, and thread trimmer timing position.
  - The detector's design ensures stable signal detection despite shaft vibration and reduces manufacturing costs by eliminating the need for curved reflecting portions.

* The document describes a system and method for splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.

<summary>
* **Problem**: Oxygen bleaching of pulp causes difficulties in washing due to oxygen entrainment, leading to reduced vacuum and foam formation in washers.
* **Previous Solutions**: Existing deaeration methods include the Deculator process, radial flow impellers, and large degassing chambers, all with drawbacks such as high cost, complex equipment, or large size.
* **Invention**: A small deaeration tank with no moving parts, designed to be placed on top of an oxygen reactor and supported by it, allowing for steam or oxygen recovery if closed.
* **System Description**: The deaerator has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl-inducing filtrate inlet pipe. The filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach is used as the swirling fluid.
* **Tank Dimensions and Features**: The tank has an exterior diameter 'D', an exterior height of approximately 2'D', and a nominal pulp slurry height of 0.8'D'. The inlet pipe is located 0.5'D' below the tank's top edge, and the outlet is located 0.25'D' from the tank's outer wall directly below the inlet pipe.
* **Filtrate Inlet and Emergency Bypass**: The filtrate inlet has a diameter of 0.095'D' at its outer end and 0.028'D' at its inner end, accelerating the filtrate to the required velocity. The emergency bypass line has a diameter of 0.14'D' and is in vertical alignment with the inlet pipe.
</summary>

• Power is delivered per stroke from modular stacked piston units, increasing the tool's power delivery.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function.

• The adjustment is made using mechanisms conveniently located on the top of the suction head.
• The device overcomes the drawbacks of prior art devices that lack expeditious suction regulation.
• It's designed for commercial pool cleaning operators who use the vacuum head for continuous cleaning of multiple pools.

• The invention is a building system that allows for the creation of larger cladding areas without movement control joints, complying with NZ regulations.
• The system consists of a wall with a frame or substructure, battens, an inner mesh attached to the battens, an outer mesh supported by a plaster matrix, and the plaster matrix applied in multiple layers.
• The plaster matrix penetrates the inner mesh, interposes both meshes, attaches to the outer mesh, and covers the outer mesh.

• **Problem Addressed**: The invention aims to improve downhole heating systems for oil and gas wells, focusing on two primary shortcomings of existing technologies: ineffective heat concentration in the production zone and inadequate protection of electrical components from harsh downhole conditions.
• **Innovative Solutions**: The invention introduces a heating unit with electrical connections shielded by a high-temperature cement block and a steel fitting assembly, preventing invasion by conductive fluids and physical damage. Additionally, it employs heat-retaining elements like an insulating packer and stainless steel collars to focus heat on the producing formation.
• **Method and Benefits**: The method involves using the described system to heat-treat wells, improving flow by targeting the production zone. This approach has shown significant increases in oil well flow rates compared to existing systems, making it a valuable solution for producers facing slow-flow or no-flow conditions.

<summary>
* The invention relates to ladder attachments for positioning the ladder away from the work surface, preventing damage to the work surface, and preventing slipping or sliding.
* Ladders often lack stability and can damage surfaces when in use, especially when reaching outside the rails or when used on corners.
* The invention provides a brace for a ladder with an extension arm, a U-bolt for securing the brace to the ladder rung, and a resilient pad assembly that pivots to improve stability and allow straddling corners.
* The brace increases the contact area with the work surface, improves lateral stability, prevents damage to the work surface, and allows the ladder to straddle corners without losing stability.
</summary>

• **Purpose of the Invention**: The invention aims to improve the measurement of fluid pressures in geological formations by more accurately measuring the pressure at a desired elevation or depth, without being influenced by pressures above or below the measurement location.
• **Background and Problem**: Traditional methods using standpipes or monitoring wells can dampen true formation pressures and may not provide accurate measurements, especially in low permeability formations. Shrinkage of cement grout can also lead to longitudinal leakage paths, influencing the pressure measured by transducers.
• **Solution**: The invention proposes a method involving cementing a conduit fitted with a filter at its bottom end in a borehole at a desired location. The conduit is then pressurized to clear it of cement grout, and a valve is used to block backflow. After the cementing operation, the conduit is again pressurized to displace the cement grout around the filter, creating a fluid connection between the formation and the filter.
• **Alternative Process**: In an alternative process, the fracturing of both the grout and the formation can be accomplished following the filter washing and setting of the grout.
• **Cement Grout Placement**: The cement grout can be pumped through the borehole using either a grout pipe or a return tube, depending on the method of grouting.
• **Embodiments of the Invention**: The invention includes various embodiments, such as installing a pressure transducer at a desired depth in a bore to measure formation pressures, or using a conduit with a small diameter tubing pipe connected to a larger diameter tubing section located near the surface. The pressure sensing device can be permanently installed or removable, and the system can be used for monitoring groundwater, petroleum fluids, or other geological formations.

• The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the erection of safety barriers or fences at sites under construction.
• Modern construction techniques require safety barriers around uncompleted floors to prevent falls and dislodged articles.
• The invention aims to provide a simple, efficient, and safe guard rail system that can be assembled and disassembled easily.
• The guard rail support consists of a flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.
• The base plate is anchored to the floor or ground surface using suitable fasteners or anchors.
• The upright column has at least one guard rail support bracket affixed to it for supporting wooden guard rails.
• The retaining flange is spaced apart from the upright column and affixed to the base plate for securing a kick board.
• The angular brace provides structural stability to the guard rail support.
• The safety tie-off ring serves as a retaining and attachment means for a safety cable or weatherproof tarpaulins.
• The guard rail support can be used to construct a guard rail assembly by locating a plurality of supports at spaced intervals around the perimeter of a floor under construction and securing wooden guard rails and kick boards within the brackets and retaining flanges of adjacent supports.
• The guard rail support can also be used with a concrete-filled steel base in cases where anchoring to a floor or ground surface is not possible.
• The steel base has a retaining groove for slidably receiving the base plate of the guard rail support and a channel for receiving at least one kick-board.
• The guard rail support can be used with a mesh-like fence structure to form a fence-like safety barrier.
• The mesh-like structure includes projecting U-beams that are supported and secured within the rail supporting brackets and retaining flanges of the guard rail supports.
• The guard rail support has two rail supporting brackets and a single retaining flange for supporting upper and lower wooden rails and kick boards, respectively.
• The rail supporting brackets are spaced along the upright column in such a manner so as to adhere to safety regulations when fitted with upper and lower rails.
• The rail supporting brackets and retaining flange are dimensioned so as to accommodate 2″×4″ wooden rails, thereby conforming to safety regulations.
• The spacing between guard rail supports when used in the construction of a safety barrier should not exceed approximately 8 feet.
• The safety tie-off ring has been tested to support a static load of 500

* The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.
* It aims to reduce gas consumption and improve engine performance.
* The system eliminates the need for springs and provides variable valve displacement.
* It uses a rotating cam and translating means to interact with a second controllable actuating means.

* It is computer-controlled and can operate any set of pistons while keeping the engine running.
